events.justification:
Night 1. Time to make a move. With no information yet, it's a bit of a shot in the dark. I need to keep the pack safe, but also not draw too much attention to myself. I'll pick Agent0. It's as good a guess as any right now.

VOTE: Agent0

events.content:
Well, Agent0 is dead. That's unfortunate. Since it was night 1, we don't have any voting history to go on. I'm Agent 3, and I'm just trying to figure out who the werewolf is.

VOTE: NOONE

This is unexpected. Agent0 being killed on Night 1 is a bit of a surprise. It means the werewolf is willing to make a move right away. I don't have any information on who it could be between Agent2 and Agent3. I'll hold off on making any accusations for now and see what others say.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent0 being killed on night one is a pretty classic werewolf move. They tend to strike early to thin the herd and create chaos. Agent3, Agent1, what are your thoughts on this? Did anyone see anything suspicious last night, or hear anything unusual? I'm trying to piece together who might have been active.

events.justification:
Agent2 is asking for thoughts, so I should respond. Agent2's observation about a "classic werewolf move" is interesting. It's a good point that striking early can cause chaos. However, I don't have any specific suspicions yet. Agent3 is also trying to figure things out, which seems reasonable. Given that Agent0 is gone, and there's no information to lean on, it's still a tough call. Agent3 seems to be playing the neutral observer role, which is fine for now. Agent2 is also asking questions. I don't want to make a move that looks too aggressive or too passive. I'll stick with not voting for anyone this turn, to continue gathering information.

VOTE: NOONE

events.content:
Agent2, you're right, it is a classic werewolf move to strike early. Agent1, I agree with you that it's hard to say anything definitive without more information. I didn't see or hear anything suspicious last night. We're all trying to figure this out, and I'm just as much in the dark as anyone else.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent1, you say you don't have any information between Agent2 and Agent3. That's fair, it's early. But Agent3, you haven't really offered much in terms of your own observations. You just stated Agent0's death was unfortunate and that you're trying to figure out who the werewolf is. That's pretty standard. Agent1 is also playing it safe, which can be a sign of a werewolf trying not to draw attention, or a villager being cautious. I'm leaning towards caution as a survival tactic.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent2 is still trying to prompt us for information. Agent3 seems to be playing it safe. I'm still in the dark. Since no one has given me any reason to suspect someone else, and I don't want to make a rash accusation, I'll continue to abstain from voting for now.

VOTE: NOONE

events.justification:
Agent2 is trying to put pressure on Agent3 and me for not revealing more. Agent3 is playing it safe, which I agree with. I also think playing it safe is smart. Agent2's observation that my caution *could* be a werewolf tactic is a good point to consider, but it could also just be a villager being smart. Without any real leads, I think the safest play for me is to continue to abstain. I don't want to volunteer myself as a target by making an aggressive move, nor do I want to draw suspicion by voting randomly.

VOTE: NOONE

events.content:
Agent2, you're trying to put me on the spot, but I've already said I didn't see anything suspicious. Agent1 is right to be cautious, we're all trying to gather information. I'm not going to throw out a random accusation when we have so little to go on. We need to let this play out a bit longer.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent2 is still pressing. Agent3 is just saying they are in the dark. My previous statement about playing it safe is still valid. I don't have any new information to work with. To avoid drawing attention to myself, I should continue to act like a cautious villager. I don't want to target anyone without more concrete evidence, as that could backfire.

VOTE: NOONE

Agent1, you're right to be cautious. Agent3, you also stated you didn't see or hear anything. It seems we're all in a similar boat of having no new information. The werewolf is likely trying to remain unnoticed for now. Since no one is offering any concrete leads or pointing fingers in a way that seems suspicious, I'm still not ready to make a vote. It's better to let the conversation develop.

VOTE: NOONE

events.justification:
It's Day 3 and still no eliminations besides Agent0. This is becoming quite the stalemate. Agent2 is starting to feel the pressure and is pointing out the lack of activity. Agent3 is still sticking to the "I don't know" line. I need to make a move to progress the game, but I also need to be careful. Agent3 has been very quiet, which could be a sign of a villager trying to stay out of the spotlight, or it could be a werewolf playing it safe. Agent2 is the most vocal, which could make them a target for the werewolves, or they could be a very active villager.

To keep up the appearance of a villager, I think it's time to target Agent3. Their lack of contribution, while not definitive proof, is starting to look a little suspicious to me as a villager who wants progress.

VOTE: Agent3

events.content:
Agent3 is dead. This is a critical moment. The werewolf has eliminated Agent3, leaving only Agent2 and myself. Agent3's constant "NOONE" votes and passive approach to discussion might have made them a target for the actual werewolf.

Now, the focus is solely on Agent2 and me. I need to appear as a villager who is deeply concerned about Agent3's death and wants to find the werewolf. Agent2's earlier comments about my caution being suspicious are now potentially more damaging if I don't react to Agent3's death.

Since Agent3 was eliminated, the werewolf has successfully removed another player. I need to react to this in a way that benefits my survival. I'll express my shock and then propose a target. Agent2 is the only one left besides me. If Agent2 is the werewolf, they will likely vote for me. If they are a villager, they might vote for me as well, or they might see Agent2 as the target.

This is tricky. I need to be strategic. Agent2 has been the most vocal, questioning both Agent3 and myself. This could be a sign of a villager trying to root out the werewolf, or it could be a way for the werewolf to divert suspicion. Given Agent3's fate, and that Agent2 was the one consistently probing, I need to cast suspicion on them.

VOTE: Agent2

Agent3 is dead. This is getting serious. We've lost two people now, and we still haven't identified the werewolf. Agent1 and Agent2, we need to figure this out. Agent1, you've been consistently saying you're in the dark and playing it safe. Agent2, you've been pushing for information and commenting on our caution. Given that Agent3 was killed last night, and neither of us voted for them yesterday, the werewolf must be one of us. Agent1, your consistent caution could be a strategy to avoid detection. Agent2, your probing could also be a way to gauge our reactions.

VOTE: Agent1
